body.p:
To T E Bramblett
Govr of Ky.

Your petitioner John McKinney would state to your excellency that at the Nov term 1863 of the Estill Circuit Court he was indicted for selling whiskey or spirits to soldiers ^& fined $60^ the facts are these he the said McKinney was acting as sutler of the 47th Kentucky regiment & by the direction of the Physician of the regiment he procurred spirits to sell & by directions of said Physician he did sell to various such soldiers spirits & did also sell to various soldiers a drink at the request & orders of the said physicians & officers that said McKinney is a good & well disposed citizen & a loyal man & believes that his fine ought to be remitted this 6th Nov 1863

Gov Bramlette I understand that the Deft McKinney sold whiskey under the direction of Dr. Daniel believing that he had a right to do so. I believe it true and hope you will remit the fine McKinney is a good man and will not be guilty of a similar violation of same

H F Finley
Comwlths atty
Granville Pearl

Grand Jury
Samuel W Newman
John C hance
J. H Barrett
Mathew McKinney
Martin Johnson
Silas Witt
Adam Mountz
Jesse Tipton
H W Jacobs
There was a good deal of Sickness in the Camp, I told some of the sick soldeers they might make use of some spirits
I believe the fine assessed against McKinney for selling liquor ought to be remitted

A. H. Clerk
Lt Col 47th Ky

I think it that the verdict against McKinney & Williams is unauthorized either by Civil or Military law they being Recognized by us as the Sutlers of our Regt being ^elected as^ such by a unaminy vote of the Regt

H. J Clark
Capt Co (G)
47 Ky vol
Capt Jackson Roberts Co ^B^
Capt John C Wilson Capt
Capt B F Blankenship
Tho H Barnes Adjt

Remit except costs & fees
Tho E Bramlette
I waited on the sick at Camp Nelson over two months there were many cases of Measels and in quite a number I of cases I recommended spirits and so informed Mckinney and williams

John. M. Daniel
surgeon. 47th. Reg. Ky. vol
